intro: Oxytropis micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, spiny stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has small, compound leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. Oxytropis micrantha is often found in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
